alert.note: Alert for Butler; Cowley (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 7:57PM CDT until May 08 at 9:50AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas... Walnut River at Winfield affecting Butler and Cowley Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Walnut River at Winfield. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Flood waters flow over County Road Cowley 2 west of the city of Rock. Then 4 miles northwest of Winfield, Cowley County Road 18 floods over a section just west of 71st Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:31 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 19.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 5.5 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Walnut River Winfield 18.0 19.2 Sat 7 pm CDT 11.5 8.0 6.5 &&
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Flooding is occurring. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
